# prefersAllColumnUserResizing

**Instance Property**

A Boolean that indicates whether the browser is set to resize all columns simultaneously rather than resizing a single column at a time.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var prefersAllColumnUserResizing: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

When the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the browser is set to resize all columns simultaneously. The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

This setting applies only to browsers that allow the user to resize columns (see the constant [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBrowser/ColumnResizingType-swift.enum/userColumnResizing]). Holding down the Option key while resizing switches the type of resizing used. This setting is persistent.

- **columnsAutosaveName**: The name used to automatically save the browser’s column configuration.

- **columnContentWidth(forColumnWidth:)**: Returns the content width for a given column width.
- **columnWidth(forColumnContentWidth:)**: Returns the column width for the width of the given column’s content.
- **columnResizingType**: A constant indicating the browser’s column resizing type.
- **width(ofColumn:)**: Returns the width of the specified column.
- **setWidth(_:ofColumn:)**: Sets the width of the specified column.
- **defaultColumnWidth()**: Returns the default column width of the browser’s columns.
- **setDefaultColumnWidth(_:)**: Sets the default column width for new browser columns that do not otherwise have an initial width from defaults or the browser’s delegate.
- **rowHeight**: The height of the browser’s rows.
